description: Borrowed from Latin recuperāre, a late form of reciperāre (“get again, regain, recover”). Doublet of recover and recoup.

verbs.description: recuperate (third-person singular simple present recuperates, present participle recuperating, simple past and past participle recuperated)

entries.meaning: To recover, especially from an illness; to get better from an illness.
(sociology) To co-opt subversive ideas for mainstream use
